definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: In those days, there was a Silent Buddha meditating in the forest near Benares.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，貝拿勒斯鄰近的森林裏有一位入定的寂靜佛。

sentences.english: In the dark night it loomed like an old monk in meditation.
sentences.chinese: 在暗夜中，它的形狀隱然如老僧入定一般。

sentences.english: This is their first attempt in meditation to carry on the goal of enjoying strength reassignment.
sentences.chinese: 這還是他們第一次嘗試入定中進行有目地的喜力調動。

sentences.english: He returned to his room, closed the door, and meditated in a high mental state throughout the night.
sentences.chinese: 聖僧返回房間，關了門，整夜都處在入定的最高境界。

sentences.english: I can’t think of article ideas if I’m not sitting in my chair.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不在椅子上，我是無法入定學習的。

definition: to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to relax with one's eyes closed
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
mind/state of mind/attention/(Chinese medicine) psychic constitution
